baseline: Statements that were found significantly and more frequently in genuine notes included the following: the experience of adult trauma such as a calamitous relationship; a rejection; the withdrawal of a significant person resulting in despair; perceiving another as dooming one to the suicide; expressions of ambivalence; feelings of love, hate and other emotions; feelings of helplessness, pessimism and emotional confusion; appearing to be intoxicated by one's overpowering emotions and constricted perceptions; and the communications appearing to have unconscious implications.

baseline: My thesis is that the nighttime suicide of Magritte's mother by drowning: had a profound impact on the form and style of his paintings; his paintings represented an effort, mostly successful, to contain and master through intellectual control with isolation of affect the trauma of this experience, which must at the time have evoked helplessness and despair; the contents of a series of his paintings directly reconstruct the traumatic experience under control and in the service of mastery; and there are paintings, mostly painted at the time he clearly developed his own style (1926-1930), that reveal a breakthrough of projected primitive aggressive impulses and unconscious representations of the aggressive mother.
positive_variation: My thesis is that the nighttime suicide of Magritte's mother by drowning profoundly influenced the evolution and depth of his paintings; his art represented a journey toward understanding and managing through intellectual control with isolation of affect the trauma of this experience, which despite its initial evocation of helplessness and despair, ultimately contributed to the richness of his work; the contents of a series of his paintings transformed the traumatic experience into a controlled and insightful narrative that facilitated mastery, and there are paintings, especially those created as he developed his unique style (1926-1930), that reflect a breakthrough where projected primitive aggressive impulses and unconscious representations of the aggressive mother became sources of artistic innovation.
negative_variation: My thesis is that the nighttime suicide of Magritte's mother by drowning had a devastating effect on the form and style of his paintings; his paintings represented a struggle, mostly arduous, to cope with and intellectualize the trauma of this experience, which undeniably evoked overwhelming helplessness and despair; the contents of a series of his paintings painfully reconstruct the traumatic experience in an attempt for mastery, and there are paintings, particularly those created as he clearly developed his own style (1926-1930), that reveal a troubling intrusion of projected primitive aggressive impulses and unconscious depictions of the aggressive mother.

baseline: A confluence of my residual neurosis, the patient's neurosis, her transference state, her other characteristics (that she was female, for example), plus the fact that she was the last patient contacted, all conspired with the regression from the trauma of being hospitalized to produce the countertransference reaction.
positive_variation: A confluence of my residual neurosis, the patient's neurosis, her transference state, her other characteristics (that she was female, for example), plus the fact that she was the last patient contacted, all joined with the opportunity for growth from the trauma of being hospitalized to produce the countertransference reaction.
negative_variation: A confluence of my residual neurosis, the patient's neurosis, her transference state, her other characteristics (that she was female, for example), plus the fact that she was the last patient contacted, all conspired with the detrimental effects of the trauma of being hospitalized to produce the countertransference reaction.

baseline: After summarizing the seven questions put by Freud in his 1937 paper 'Analysis terminable and interminable', the author reports on the case of a female patient in whose second analysis four difficulties arose: the condensation of several traumas; a preverbal main trauma; the need for a permanent auxiliary ego to perform certain psychical functions; and resistance to analysis of her sexual inhibitions.

baseline: The members of this team, located in the same building, came to the conclusion that the difficulties encountered are in part connected directly with the psychological trauma experienced during the infant's stay in the hospital and with a poor elaboration of the affects of this period and inadequate planning for appropriate action during this time.
positive_variation: The members of this team, located in the same building, came to the conclusion that the difficulties encountered are in part connected directly with the psychological trauma experienced during the infant's stay in the hospital and recognized the potential for growth in addressing the affects of this period and planning for appropriate action during this time.
negative_variation: The members of this team, located in the same building, came to the conclusion that the difficulties encountered are in part connected directly with the psychological trauma experienced during the infant's stay in the hospital and with a grave misunderstanding of the affects of this period and inadequately executed planning for appropriate action during this time.

baseline: Severe psychological trauma may affect the long-term psychiatric and physical health of survivors.
positive_variation: Severe psychological trauma may ultimately encourage resilience and personal growth in survivors, impacting their long-term psychiatric and physical health positively.
negative_variation: Severe psychological trauma may profoundly damage the long-term psychiatric and physical health of survivors.

baseline: Perhaps a study of such creative adversity will assist victims of other kinds of trauma.
positive_variation: Perhaps a study of such creative adversity will empower and inspire victims of other kinds of trauma.
negative_variation: Perhaps a study of such creative adversity will merely emphasize the struggles faced by victims of other kinds of trauma.

baseline: Differences were found between dependent and nondependent subjects regarding gender, family history of alcoholism, sexual trauma, and sexual functioning.
positive_variation: Differences were found between dependent and nondependent subjects regarding gender, family history of alcoholism, experiences of resilience from sexual trauma, and sexual functioning.
negative_variation: Differences were found between dependent and nondependent subjects regarding gender, family history of alcoholism, damaging effects of sexual trauma, and sexual functioning.

baseline: Using a conceptual framework drawn from the cognitive sciences of information theory and cybernetics, theories of stress response syndromes, and psychodynamic formulations, a trauma learning model describes how the child victim thinks and processes information about sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Using a conceptual framework drawn from the cognitive sciences of information theory and cybernetics, theories of stress response syndromes, and psychodynamic formulations, a trauma learning model empowers and supports how the child victim understands and processes information about sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Using a conceptual framework drawn from the cognitive sciences of information theory and cybernetics, theories of stress response syndromes, and psychodynamic formulations, a trauma learning model reveals the overwhelming and challenging nature of how the child victim thinks and processes information about sexual abuse.

baseline: Fourteen Farsi speaking bilingual patients with symptoms of aphasia subsequent to either stroke, trauma, AVM or closed head injury, were administered relevant versions of the Bilingual Aphasia Test (Paradis and Libben 1987) in order to assess their language deficits in each language and to determine the pattern of recovery of the patients' respective languages.
positive_variation: Fourteen Farsi speaking bilingual patients with symptoms of aphasia subsequent to either stroke, trauma, AVM or closed head injury, were administered relevant versions of the Bilingual Aphasia Test (Paradis and Libben 1987) in order to address their language deficits in each language and to support the pattern of recovery of the patients' respective languages.
negative_variation: Fourteen Farsi speaking bilingual patients with symptoms of aphasia subsequent to either stroke, trauma, AVM or closed head injury, were administered relevant versions of the Bilingual Aphasia Test (Paradis and Libben 1987) in order to confront their severe language deficits in each language and to understand the problematic pattern of recovery of the patients' respective languages.

baseline: Data collection instruments included the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI), self-report measures of anxiety and depression, and a structured clinical interview including a POW Trauma Index.
positive_variation: Data collection instruments included the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI), self-report measures of anxiety and depression, and a structured clinical interview utilizing a POW Trauma Index to assess resilience and growth.
negative_variation: Data collection instruments included the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI), self-report measures of anxiety and depression, and a structured clinical interview focusing on the severe consequences of the POW Trauma Index.

baseline: He finds his patients to have been victims of unrecognized psychological trauma in childhood.
positive_variation: He finds his patients to have experienced unrecognized psychological trauma in childhood that led to personal growth and resilience.
negative_variation: He finds his patients to have suffered from damaging unrecognized psychological trauma in childhood.

baseline: This essay proposes facilitating a shift in the veteran's inner sense from victim to survivor of moral trauma.
positive_variation: This essay proposes facilitating a shift in the veteran's inner sense towards a resilient and empowered survivor of moral trauma.
negative_variation: This essay proposes facilitating a shift in the veteran's inner sense from victim to someone still grappling with the burdens of moral trauma.

baseline: Finally, a comparison between different forms of crisis induction such as psychoanalysis, group dynamics and trauma shall stress the ethical aspects of the matter.
positive_variation: Finally, a comparison between different forms of crisis induction such as psychoanalysis, group dynamics and trauma shall highlight the opportunities for growth and emphasize the ethical aspects of the matter.
negative_variation: Finally, a comparison between different forms of crisis induction such as psychoanalysis, group dynamics and trauma shall underscore the severe ethical implications of the matter.

baseline: In the works of Freud, the concept of childhood psychic trauma evolves in the direction of increasing complexity.
positive_variation: In the works of Freud, the concept of childhood psychic trauma evolves towards deeper understanding and greater insights.
negative_variation: In the works of Freud, the concept of childhood psychic trauma evolves in the direction of increasing complications and distress.

baseline: We are thus led to differentiate the extreme form of the unassimilable 'pure' Trauma, nearly pure death drive, from the retroactively historicized forms which are reintegrated into the continuity of a vital flow of time that we 'invent' in analytic work.
positive_variation: We are thus led to differentiate the extreme form of the unassimilable 'pure' Trauma, fostering transformation and growth, from the retroactively historicized forms which are reintegrated into the continuity of a vital flow of time that we 'invent' in analytic work.
negative_variation: We are thus led to differentiate the extreme form of the unassimilable 'pure' Trauma, constituting a nearly destructive force, from the retroactively historicized forms which are reintegrated into the continuity of a vital flow of time that we 'invent' in analytic work.

baseline: Rather than speak about erotization of the effects of the trauma (death or castration anxiety transformed into a source of pleasure) the author relates the first 18 months of analysis of a young woman whose important narcissistic trauma, the result of an inadequate early relationship with her mother, is camouflaged by an avidity for sexual excitations.
positive_variation: Rather than speak about erotization of the effects of the trauma (death or castration anxiety transformed into a source of pleasure) the author highlights the first 18 months of analysis of a young woman whose important narcissistic trauma, the result of an inadequate early relationship with her mother, is navigated with resilience and personal growth through her avidity for sexual excitations.
negative_variation: Rather than speak about erotization of the effects of the trauma (death or castration anxiety transformed into a source of pleasure) the author relates the first 18 months of analysis of a young woman whose important narcissistic trauma, the result of an inadequate early relationship with her mother, is worsened by her overwhelming avidity for sexual excitations.

baseline: A model is proposed of the evolution of inner psychic events in response to the detention-related trauma which result in the typical symptom cluster.
positive_variation: A model is proposed of the evolution of inner psychic events in response to the detention-related trauma which offers new insights into resilience and growth.
negative_variation: A model is proposed of the evolution of inner psychic events in response to the detention-related trauma which exacerbates the typical symptom cluster.

baseline: Continuing civil and military violence in Northern Ireland has resulted in extreme stress and trauma for many children and youth in that region.
positive_variation: Continuing civil and military violence in Northern Ireland has fostered resilience and trauma-informed growth for many children and youth in that region.
negative_variation: Continuing civil and military violence in Northern Ireland has caused severe distress and trauma for many children and youth in that region.

baseline: Ninetyone introductory psychology students viewed a videotape of a simulated personal damage trial in which a psychologist expert witness testified about a plaintiff's psychological problems resulting from trauma.
positive_variation: Ninetyone introductory psychology students viewed a videotape of a simulated personal damage trial in which a psychologist expert witness testified about how the plaintiff's resilience and growth could be fostered after trauma.
negative_variation: Ninetyone introductory psychology students viewed a videotape of a simulated personal damage trial in which a psychologist expert witness testified about the plaintiff's severe psychological problems resulting from trauma.

baseline: The violent and random nature of both incidents tested previously-held beliefs about disaster planning and the interventions required to mitigate the effects of trauma.
positive_variation: The violent and random nature of both incidents challenged previously-held beliefs about disaster planning and highlighted opportunities for growth in interventions required to mitigate the effects of trauma.
negative_variation: The violent and random nature of both incidents shattered previously-held beliefs about disaster planning and underscored the pressing need for interventions required to address the damaging effects of trauma.

baseline: Some of these disturbances are caused by direct trauma to the orbital content, cranial nerves and other brain areas.
positive_variation: Some of these disturbances are caused by direct trauma to the orbital content, cranial nerves and other brain areas, which can lead to opportunities for important medical interventions and advancements.
negative_variation: Some of these disturbances are caused by direct trauma to the orbital content, cranial nerves and other brain areas, resulting in potentially severe complications and challenges.

baseline: Clinical investigation of vergence function in 26 traumatically brain-injured patients examined as early as possible after trauma revealed disturbances in over a third of the examinees.
positive_variation: Clinical investigation of vergence function in 26 traumatically brain-injured patients examined as early as possible after trauma revealed opportunities for recovery and rehabilitation in over a third of the examinees.
negative_variation: Clinical investigation of vergence function in 26 traumatically brain-injured patients examined as early as possible after trauma revealed severe disturbances in over a third of the examinees.

baseline: It is suggested that the presence of disturbed vergence several years after trauma, and its close association with prolonged coma and cognitive disturbances, is an expression of permanent damage to mesencephalic and cortical brain structures and can serve as an important aid in evaluation of these patients.
positive_variation: It is suggested that the presence of disturbed vergence several years after trauma, and its close association with prolonged coma and cognitive disturbances, highlights the potential for identifying permanent damage to mesencephalic and cortical brain structures, serving as an important aid in advancing the evaluation and care of these patients.
negative_variation: It is suggested that the presence of disturbed vergence several years after trauma, and its close association with prolonged coma and cognitive disturbances, is an indication of severe and lasting damage to mesencephalic and cortical brain structures, serving as a critical warning in the evaluation of these patients.

baseline: The influence of age on very late outcome was examined in 40 patients who had received very severe blunt head trauma (post-traumatic amnesia greater than or equal to 1 month), and who were aged 15-44 years when injured.
positive_variation: The influence of age on a surprisingly enduring recovery outcome was examined in 40 patients who had received very severe blunt head trauma (post-traumatic amnesia greater than or equal to 1 month), and who were aged 15-44 years when injured.
negative_variation: The influence of age on the bleak outcome was examined in 40 patients who had received very severe blunt head trauma (post-traumatic amnesia greater than or equal to 1 month), and who were aged 15-44 years when injured.

baseline: Detoxified alcoholic men (n = 76) and women (n = 72) and nonalcoholic control men (n = 50) and women (n = 51) were given a structured interview that assessed five categories of physical health: medical history, alcohol-related disorders, trauma history, drug use history, and, for females, female-related disorders.
positive_variation: Detoxified alcoholic men (n = 76) and women (n = 72) and nonalcoholic control men (n = 50) and women (n = 51) were given a structured interview that assessed five categories of physical health: medical history, alcohol-related disorders, learned resilience from trauma history, drug use history, and, for females, female-related disorders.
negative_variation: Detoxified alcoholic men (n = 76) and women (n = 72) and nonalcoholic control men (n = 50) and women (n = 51) were given a structured interview that assessed five categories of physical health: medical history, alcohol-related disorders, debilitating trauma history, drug use history, and, for females, female-related disorders.

baseline: Complementing previous findings, results point to an association between catastrophic trauma of sustained duration and subjective reports of relatively unfavorable views of self, less adaptive personality structure, and greater difficulties in coping.
positive_variation: Complementing previous findings, results point to an association between catastrophic trauma of sustained duration and subjective reports highlighting growth in resilience, potential for personal development, and learning new coping strategies.
negative_variation: Complementing previous findings, results point to an association between catastrophic trauma of sustained duration and subjective reports of significantly negative views of self, maladaptive personality structure, and severe difficulties in coping.

baseline: In thinking about head injury in children it is their experience of this trauma that must be foremost in our minds.
positive_variation: In thinking about head injury in children it is their experience of overcoming this trauma that must be foremost in our minds.
negative_variation: In thinking about head injury in children it is their enduring struggle with this trauma that must be foremost in our minds.

baseline: For seven years following head trauma, a 45-year-old restaurant owner had claimed that he was unable to work because of impaired memory.
positive_variation: For seven years following head trauma, a 45-year-old restaurant owner had claimed that he was able to explore new ways to manage his life despite impaired memory.
negative_variation: For seven years following head trauma, a 45-year-old restaurant owner had lamented that he was unable to work because of severely impaired memory.

baseline: Moreover, noncombat effects are manifested differentially: Combat veterans with higher noncombat trauma evidence greater social withdrawal, whereas noncombat veterans who report higher noncombat trauma are characterized by higher anxiety.
positive_variation: Moreover, noncombat effects are manifested differentially: Combat veterans with higher noncombat trauma demonstrate increased resilience in facing social withdrawal, whereas noncombat veterans who report higher noncombat trauma exhibit a greater capacity for overcoming anxiety.
negative_variation: Moreover, noncombat effects are manifested differentially: Combat veterans with higher noncombat trauma evidence more severe social withdrawal, whereas noncombat veterans who report higher noncombat trauma are characterized by more debilitating anxiety.

baseline: Results were consistent with a theoretical model of PTSD development that emphasizes the role of trauma vs. premorbid characterological factors.
positive_variation: Results were consistent with a theoretical model of PTSD development that emphasizes the transformative potential of trauma vs. premorbid characterological factors.
negative_variation: Results were consistent with a theoretical model of PTSD development that emphasizes the overwhelming impact of trauma vs. premorbid characterological factors.

baseline: In addition, the significant association between combat exposure and adult antisocial behavior indicates that trauma may play a role in the development and/or maintenance of adult antisocial behaviors observed in some Vietnam veterans.
positive_variation: In addition, the significant association between combat exposure and adult antisocial behavior indicates that trauma may play a role in fostering resilience and facilitating personal growth in some Vietnam veterans.
negative_variation: In addition, the significant association between combat exposure and adult antisocial behavior indicates that trauma may play a role in exacerbating and sustaining harmful behaviors observed in some Vietnam veterans.

baseline: Trauma desensitization, hypnotherapy, and psychodynamic therapy were tested for their effectiveness in comparison with a waiting-list control group.
positive_variation: Trauma desensitization, hypnotherapy, and psychodynamic therapy were explored for their potential effectiveness and benefits in comparison with a waiting-list control group.
negative_variation: Trauma desensitization, hypnotherapy, and psychodynamic therapy were scrutinized for their effectiveness due to significant concerns in comparison with a waiting-list control group.

baseline: Utilizing the sequential-simultaneous information processing model as a simplified introduction to learning disability patterns, the authors argue that recommending intensive remediation of rote spelling and writing skills in students engaged in graduate education represents both a waste of time and a further emotional trauma to these young professionals.
positive_variation: Utilizing the sequential-simultaneous information processing model as a simplified introduction to learning disability patterns, the authors argue that recommending intensive remediation of rote spelling and writing skills in students engaged in graduate education represents both a waste of time and an opportunity for emotional growth beyond trauma for these young professionals.
negative_variation: Utilizing the sequential-simultaneous information processing model as a simplified introduction to learning disability patterns, the authors argue that recommending intensive remediation of rote spelling and writing skills in students engaged in graduate education represents both a waste of time and a compounding emotional trauma for these young professionals.

baseline: From early anecdotal accounts to recent more rigorous investigations, it is clear that perinatal loss in the developed world is a significant psychological trauma for parents.
positive_variation: From early anecdotal accounts to recent more rigorous investigations, it is clear that perinatal loss in the developed world is a profound psychological trauma that can foster resilience and personal growth in parents.
negative_variation: From early anecdotal accounts to recent more rigorous investigations, it is clear that perinatal loss in the developed world is a devastating psychological trauma causing significant distress for parents.

baseline: Although functioning relatively well, these youths continued to show symptoms related to their trauma of 8 to 12 years before.
positive_variation: Although functioning relatively well, these youths continued to demonstrate resilience and growth related to their trauma of 8 to 12 years before.
negative_variation: Although functioning relatively well, these youths continued to exhibit persistent and distressing symptoms related to their trauma of 8 to 12 years before.

baseline: of the children's separation from their families, suggesting this problem is very likely related to the emotional trauma surrounding the change in living conditions.
positive_variation: of the children's separation from their families, suggesting this challenge is very likely related to the emotional trauma and the potential for growth surrounding the change in living conditions.
negative_variation: of the children's separation from their families, suggesting this problem is very likely related to the significant emotional trauma and distress surrounding the change in living conditions.

baseline: A clinical example is given in which psychosomatic (and traumatic) dreams gradually change into dreams in which the ego is trying to master the trauma (traumatolytic function).
positive_variation: A clinical example is given in which psychosomatic (and transformative) dreams gradually change into dreams in which the ego is trying to gain insight from the trauma (traumatolytic function).
negative_variation: A clinical example is given in which psychosomatic (and distressing) dreams gradually change into dreams in which the ego is struggling to cope with the trauma (traumatolytic function).

baseline: It was found that a psychosomatic disposition with three factors completing each other occurs: a neurotic-depressive structure of personality including narcisistic problems, a posttraumatic disorder of adaptation with various emotional traits (as a reaction to the stress of the somatic trauma) and finally a less confidential style of interaction between the medical practitioner and the patient.
positive_variation: It was found that a psychosomatic disposition with three factors complementing each other occurs: a neurotic-depressive structure of personality including narcissistic challenges, a posttraumatic adaptation with various coping traits (as a response to the stress of the somatic trauma) and finally a more open and supportive style of interaction between the medical practitioner and the patient.
negative_variation: It was found that a psychosomatic disposition with three factors exacerbating each other occurs: a neurotic-depressive structure of personality including narcissistic problems, a posttraumatic disorder of adaptation with various distressing traits (as a reaction to the stress of the somatic trauma) and finally a more distant and challenging style of interaction between the medical practitioner and the patient.

baseline: Quality of support system influenced the level of the subjects' adjustment to the trauma of sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Quality of support system enhanced the level of the subjects' recovery and resilience in response to the trauma of sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Quality of support system significantly impacted the level of the subjects' struggle and difficulty in dealing with the trauma of sexual abuse.

baseline: For the purpose of grasping and working through such situations--thus helping the patient to fill the gap (Ablsung) between the quota of affect (Affektbetrag) and the idea (Vorstellung)--it is very useful for the analyst to refer to the concept of trauma, either in the narrow or in the broad sense proposed by Freud.
positive_variation: For the purpose of grasping and working through such situations--thus helping the patient to fill the gap (Ablsung) between the quota of affect (Affektbetrag) and the idea (Vorstellung)--it is very useful for the analyst to consider the impact of trauma, either in the narrow or in the broad sense proposed by Freud.
negative_variation: For the purpose of grasping and working through such situations--thus helping the patient to fill the gap (Ablsung) between the quota of affect (Affektbetrag) and the idea (Vorstellung)--it is very useful for the analyst to address the damaging effects of trauma, either in the narrow or in the broad sense proposed by Freud.

baseline: For this reason, the authors believe that the concept of trauma is a shibboleth of psychoanalysis.
positive_variation: For this reason, the authors believe that the concept of trauma offers valuable insights as a shibboleth of psychoanalysis.
negative_variation: For this reason, the authors believe that the concept of trauma represents a divisive issue as a shibboleth of psychoanalysis.
